channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Joe, Cecile, and Francis — A Story of Western Cultural Incoherence
item.description: Do we still remember freedom?

item.title: Trump holds off on tariffs after Colombia agrees to take migrant planes
item.description: President Trump was triumphant in getting Colombia to accept deportees from the United States late Sunday after the Colombian president railed against...

item.title: In Wisconsin Supreme Court Race, Only Brad Schimel Will Protect Election Laws
item.description: Wisconsin voters choose between a constitutionalist conservative and a leftist judicial activist seeking to usurp the state's legislature.

item.title: DeSantis faces GOP resistance to special legislative session on immigration that starts today
item.description: A special legislative session called by Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis to take up a series of proposals to help implement President Donald Trump's immigrat...

item.title: 'Back to our roots': Female GOP lawmakers work to win back feminism from the left
item.description: Republican women are working to flip the decadeslong narrative that Democrats are the party of women.

item.title: Senate slated to vote on South Carolina billionaire hedge fund executive to lead US Treasury
item.description: Trump's Treasury secretary pick, Scott Bessent, says extending the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act is the 'single most important economic issue of the day'

item.title: Spanberger and Earle-Sears want to make history in Virginia. But voters have election exhaustion
item.description: Just weeks after former Rep. Abigail Spanberger left the U.S. House for good, she strolled onto the floor of a different political chamber: the Virgin...

item.title: Trump order ending birthright citizenship for illegal immigrants is constitutional, expert says
item.description: "It'll get to the U.S. Supreme Court, and if the court follows the actual legislative intent and history, they will uphold what Donald Trump has done,...

item.title: Affirmative Action Is Still Alive and Well. Trump Can Kill It
item.description: Many institutions continue to discriminate on the basis of race. Here’s what the president can do to stop the practice once and for all.

item.title: The New York Times Still Refuses To Admit Kash Patel Was Right About Russiagate
item.description: Few people understand the FBI's Russia hoax abuses as well as Kash Patel, which is probably why The New York Times hates him.

item.title: Illegal immigrant forced to drink his urine to stay alive in desert
item.description: A Chinese illegal immigrant lost in the Arizona desert said he was forced to abandon his brother in the desert and to drink his own urine to survive.

item.title: Indiana Attorney General Sues South Bend Sheriff For Refusing To Enforce Immigration Laws
item.description: Sheriff Bill Redman, a Democrat, says his department does comply with state and federal laws requiring cooperation with federal authorities.

item.title: School Choice in Ohio Defies Critics’ Cheap Caricature
item.description: A recent hit piece on educational-freedom efforts in the state willfully misrepresents the immense benefits Ohioans are seeing.

item.title: Mike Lee continues calling for abolition of TSA
item.description: Sen. Mike Lee is continuing to advocate for the abolition of the Transportation Security Administration.

item.title: Haitian migrants in Springfield, Ohio, turn to faith amid deportation fears
item.description: At the end of his Sunday service, the pastor of the First Haitian Evangelical Church of Springfield, Ohio, asked ushers and musicians to form a circle...

item.title: NCAA Keeps Touting ‘Fairness’ While Refusing To Ban Men From Women’s Sports
item.description: The NCAA doesn't need to wait for Trump to issue additional guidance and force its hand to protect our female athletes.

item.title: Vance says lowering grocery prices will 'take a little bit of time'
item.description: Vice President J.D. Vance said that grocery prices will come down, but told his interviewer that he and President Trump have been in power less than a...

item.title: Donald Trump Is A ‘Malevolent Coxcomb,’ And Other Deranged Takes From Nicholas Carr
item.description: Nicholas Carr’s new book is like watching Michael Jordan on the Wizards: flashes of a former brilliance but mostly a wish he’d stayed retired.

item.title: Forgetting Paris
item.description: President Trump was right to pull the U.S. out of the rotten climate change agreement.

item.title: Gone, the Assads
item.description: On the rise and fall of Syria’s dictatorial dynasty.
